tweets.html:
What I can't believe watching "The Newsroom" is that Aaron Sorkin and I went to the same shrink.

— Bret Easton Ellis (@BretEastonEllis) July 2, 2012

Really wish someone, somewhere would write an online piece taking down Aaron Sorkin. Feels like ripe territory for a brave contrarian.

— Steven Zeitchik (@ZeitchikWaPo) July 2, 2012

I bet more people meant to tweet their disapproval of last night's NEWSROOM but couldn't, due to their uncoordinated woman-fingers.

— Andy Greenwald (@andygreenwald) July 2, 2012

Newsroom could have had McHale accidentally send a DM publically -- Weiner style -- but I'm not sure if Sorkin knows what a "Twitter" is.

— Daniel Walters (@danieltwalters) July 2, 2012

By this point THE NEWSROOM should probably just change its title to LOW-HANGING FRUIT.

— MZS (@mattzollerseitz) July 2, 2012

HBO renewing The Newsroom is a spoiler for season three of The Newsroom

— slackbot (@pareene) July 2, 2012

I hope Newsroom takes on the Twitter backlash to Newsroom is season six.

— Cory Barker (@corybarker) July 2, 2012

HBO gives "Newsroom" lovers another year to pretend to be a disenfranchised demographic.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) July 2, 2012

The Newsroom has been renewed, and I'm worried people are going to run out of funny things to say about it in a week ago.

— Bah, Handlen! (@zhandlen) July 2, 2012

Unironically happy that Newsroom was renewed. Obv, I dislike the show, but I'm fascinated by the debate‚Äîand who knows, maybe it'll improve?

— Emily Nussbaum (@emilynussbaum) July 2, 2012

Also, has anyone compared it to Treme? Because it just occurred to me that HBO now has two dramas that take place in past-realtime.

— Emily Nussbaum (@emilynussbaum) July 2, 2012

@emilynussbaum I know Treme, Emily, and The Newsroom is no Treme. (crowd erupts)...

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) July 2, 2012

Hope #Treme gets its final s4 as a reward (for me) for dealing w/ the fact that HBO renewed #TheNewsroom & won't release me from #TrueBlood.

— battling bard üéÑ‚ùÑÔ∏è (@katetocci) July 2, 2012

Someone told me the second season of Enlightenment follows Laura Dern's breakdown after watching the first season of The Newsroom.

— bobby finger (@bobbyfinger) July 2, 2012

The third episode of "The Newsroom" is forty hours long? Kind of a weird choice but who am I to argue with an Oscar winner, right? #asterisk

— Tara Ariano (@TaraAriano) July 3, 2012

Thank God I can wash the taste of "The Newsroom" out of my mouth with the prom episode of "90210." #bh90210 #drunkdonna #classics

— Tara Ariano (@TaraAriano) July 3, 2012

30 secs into Newsroom ep 2, and @mikehamiltonWP and I are screaming at it. No news EP would say '4 a.m. in the morning.' Come on, Sorks. -H

— Heather & Jessica (@fuggirls) July 3, 2012

If only more people openly hated women we'd have so many more TV shows and movies

— Julie Klausner (@julieklausner) July 2, 2012

Had that classic nightmare where you're naked at school and didn't study and everyone thinks you're on Team Jake. #Awkward

— Brandon üö∑ (@bnowalk) July 2, 2012

FYI The next holiday coming up is the 4th of July. It will be held this year on July the 4th. #ParksandRec @parksandrecnbc

— Perd Hapley (@PerdHapley) July 2, 2012

Louie reviews are gonna be so positive they‚Äôd create backlash, except that the show is good enough to withstand it. #morebacklash

— Emily Nussbaum (@emilynussbaum) July 2, 2012

It's a good thing Anderson Cooper came out in a blog post rather than on CNN. Now people will actually see it.

— Jess Dweck (@TheDweck) July 2, 2012

Anderson Cooper: "Also, my face was carved by angels."

— Jocelyn Plums (@ColoradoUgly) July 2, 2012

Best part of HuffPo story on Anderson Cooper being gay ‚Äî "This is a breaking story. Check back for updates." Can't wait to find out how gay!

— Eugene Mirman (@EugeneMirman) July 2, 2012

Your move, Shepard Smith.

— Andrew Ungvari (@DrewUnga) July 2, 2012

I feel like Anderson Cooper threw in that "I love, and I am loved" bit to preemptively spurn my advances.

— Louis Peitzman (@LouisPeitzman) July 2, 2012

My mom is sadly crossing Anderson Cooper off the list of people she would like me to marry.

— A.S. Paul (@aspaul) July 2, 2012

Anderson Cooper would be the best at coming out. Damn it, though. #WeStillGotGosling

— ishira kumar (@ishirakumar) July 2, 2012

Now that Anderson Cooper has come out as gay, I can come out and say that I am straight but would still definitely make out with him.

— Ken Tremendous (@KenTremendous) July 2, 2012

Anderson Cooper was only in the closet to protect himself from the sun's harmful rays. #white

— Chris Regan (@ChrisRRegan) July 2, 2012

BREAKING: Wolf Blitzer not really a wolf.

— rob delaney (@robdelaney) July 2, 2012

Anderson Cooper admits that he's 97% chalk.

— Chris Regan (@ChrisRRegan) July 2, 2012

CNN is reporting that every person on Twitter is making the same joke about CNN reporting that Anderson Cooper is straight.

— John Moe (@johnmoe) July 2, 2012

Tom Cruise is now single, and Anderson Cooper is out of the closet? Hmmm. Sorry, Tom, that's #MissionImpossible

— ishira kumar (@ishirakumar) July 2, 2012

What's all this about Anderson Cooper revealing that there is a news network called CNN?

— Miles Kahn (@mileskahn) July 2, 2012

Crazy how Will McAvoy broke the Anderson Cooper is gay story before Anderson Cooper. (Did anybody do this one already?)

— Zach üö∑ (@zhaldeman) July 2, 2012

Anderson Cooper being gay is not news. Anderson Cooper being gay for me is news.

— Josh Hara (@yoyoha) July 2, 2012

BREAKNG: #FOX reports that Anderson Cooper is a tax.

— Doug *Not Jones* Osborne (@seriousfun8309) July 2, 2012

So far, Anderson Cooper coming out does not appear to have threatened the sanctity of traditional newscasts.

— pourmecoffee (@pourmecoffee) July 2, 2012

I don't care, I'm still gonna make a run at Anderson Cooper

— Mindy Kaling (@mindykaling) July 2, 2012

Chord Overstreet and Benedict Cumberbatch better be having sex, or why the hell did Anderson Cooper come out?

— B Haynes (@barbhaynes) July 3, 2012

Those thinking that Anderson Cooper coming out is not a big deal clearly don't have a clue what it is to be gay and in the closet.

— Tom & Lorenzo (@tomandlorenzo) July 3, 2012

who is anderson copper?

— Ellyas Enda Hadinata (@ellyasenda) July 3, 2012

I will not contribute to a Kickstarter until there is one for a DVD/Blu-ray release of Terriers.

— Mychal Stanley (@urthstripe) July 2, 2012

If you were on the fence about #FallingSkies, they just introduced a white freestyle rapper character, so some pretty quality TV here...

— Evan Kirby (@evankirby) July 2, 2012

Are all of television's worst characters on True Blood or just like 8 of the top 10?

— Cory Barker (@corybarker) July 2, 2012

Holly Marie Combs is looking great on #PLL this season. Her hair sure is purty. #shallowtweet

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) July 3, 2012

Also, Aria's clothes are officially out of control. She's wearing an acid-washed denim skirt with front seams. #PLL #stopthemadness

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) July 3, 2012

Fake marriages splitting up, iconic anchors coming out, wow, #MagicMike is cutting a swath thru America.

— B Haynes (@barbhaynes) July 2, 2012

Interesting box office stat on "Magic Mike": It's the first film to sell more than 80% of its tickets to ironic moviegoers.

— Ben Fritz (@benfritz) July 2, 2012

So, Channing Tatum is basically Mark Wahlberg without the "At any minute, I could suddenly mug you" thing. There's a place for that.

— MZS (@mattzollerseitz) July 3, 2012

Just got out of #MagicMike. Or as I now call it "When Bad Scripts Happen to Spectacular Asses."

— Damian Holbrook (@damianholbrook) July 3, 2012

I feel bad for the New York-based DNA lab that goes out of business the day after Maury Povich's show gets axed.

— Josh Spiegel (@mousterpiece) July 2, 2012

Just heard a black weatherman say "drizzle" & am ashamed to say that for a second I thought he was doing that Snoop Dogg thing.

— Danny Zuker (@DannyZuker) July 2, 2012

I'm writing a pilot about a pilot who is writing a pilot about being a pilot. It is not good.

— Jack Burditt (@jackburditt) July 2, 2012

tweets.html:
There's drag makeup, and then there's Paula Deen's makeup on last night's Food Network Star.

— Austin Morris, Real Housewife of Madison (@austindotTV) July 2, 2012

ANDERSON COOPER'S NOT THE ONLY FUCKING ONE WITH AN UNEXPECTED ANNOUNCEMENT TODAY. #EASTBOUNDhttp://t.co/u0pkKqqV

— KFUCKINGP (@KFUCKINGP) July 3, 2012

If I understand HBO's logic, it's renewing Eastbound & Down because Danny McBride actually brought back some horses from the dead.

— Andy (@AndyDaglas) July 3, 2012

I assume that Glee's writers will lose track of most of the cast's episode count, resulting in hilarity in the final few weeks of S4.

— Cory Barker (@corybarker) July 3, 2012

Can I get a gif of "Why? Why? Why? Why?" #GlassHouse

— Mike McComb (@Rube_Goldberg) July 3, 2012

My favorite part of the week is seeing the facial expression of the rejected #GlassHouse person as they go down the drain.

— Andy Dehnart (@realityblurred) July 3, 2012

Oh Gene, I liked you so much. But then you said "showmance" and now you are dead to me. #GlassHouse

— Mike McComb (@Rube_Goldberg) July 3, 2012

Why are homophobes always morons? "I do not believe on acting on homosexuality tendencies." -Andrea, #TheGlassHouse

— Andy Dehnart (@realityblurred) July 3, 2012

You would think after 3 years I would know better than to read a Parenthood script in public. Just read the season opener... Sobbing.

— Sarah Watson (@SarahWatson42) July 3, 2012

Watching Seinfeld with my dad is like seeing an ape in it's natural habitat.

— Josh Hara (@yoyoha) July 3, 2012

RT if you remember concrete details of a single episode of Covert Affairs

— Cory Barker (@corybarker) July 3, 2012

In fairness to the school board, they DID warn students about the consequences of drinking at prom, and Donna WAS drunk. #bh90210

— Tara Ariano (@TaraAriano) July 3, 2012

once circa age 21 I asked a successful TV writer what the key was and he said "naps"

— Molly Lambert (@mollylambert) July 3, 2012

I wonder if I'll ever be able to watch #Serenity without crying like a baby at least 10 separate times.

— Casey McCormick (@virtualcasey) July 3, 2012

I would have watched a show that was just Angel, Spike, Drusilla and Darla wreaking havoc across Europe. #BuffyS2CatchUp

— Deck The Hal-Les (@Lesismore9o9) July 3, 2012

Of all weeks for Soup hiatus, I hear Jersey Housewife Teresa argue, "I dont have a computer in my head. I dont store things in my brain."

— Matthew Carney (@matthewcarney) July 3, 2012

Higgs and Boson. They're cops.

— Josh A. Cagan (@joshacagan) July 3, 2012

Chris professes love. Follows up profession with some kind of Polish dance show. I'm not sure that's quite the way to go. #bachelorette

— Jennifer Weiner (@jenniferweiner) July 3, 2012

congrats to Jef for finding the skinniest jeans in Utah. #Bachelorette

— Damian Holbrook (@damianholbrook) July 3, 2012

We're at Jef's ranch. Where, in my imagination, the cattle are all branded with Jef's missing F. #bachelorette

— Jennifer Weiner (@jenniferweiner) July 3, 2012

love letter. Zzzzzzzzzzzzzz. #Bachelorette

— Damian Holbrook (@damianholbrook) July 3, 2012

Do guys write letters and read them aloud to their ladies in real life? Is this a thing that happens? #TheBachelorette

— Cassie Belek (@cassiebelek) July 3, 2012

Commercials. Ladies are mean and say "no" all the time to their kids and their husbands.The right roasted turkey will save them.

— Jennifer Weiner (@jenniferweiner) July 3, 2012

Arie's dad says Emily has "great qualities." Yeah. The left one and the right one. #bachelorette

— Jennifer Weiner (@jenniferweiner) July 3, 2012

Chris' family is sweet and adorable. But enough of that. Bring on the drama!!! #TheBachelorette

— Cassie Belek (@cassiebelek) July 3, 2012

The Bachelorette this year is "Emily," so if she gives you a rose, do you become a dessicated corpse? #faulknerjokes

— Jeffrey Sconce (@JeffreySconce) July 3, 2012

Arie's mother is auditioning for the Real Housewives of Scottsdale. #TheBachelorette

— Cassie Belek (@cassiebelek) July 3, 2012

We're all worried Emily's teeth are going to fall out onto the bar in one giant piece, right? #Bachelorette

— B Haynes (@barbhaynes) July 3, 2012

Uh oh. Chris is looking stabby again. #TheBachelorette

— Cassie Belek (@cassiebelek) July 3, 2012

Chris' mom is either a chronic gesturer or she's desperate to show off her French manicure. #Bachelorette

— B Haynes (@barbhaynes) July 3, 2012

Considering hundreds of people have been on multiple seasons of this show, they sure use the word UNIQUE a lot. #Bachelorette

— B Haynes (@barbhaynes) July 3, 2012

I love how they show stuff that happened 45 minutes ago in soft, yellow light like it happened 3 CENTURIES AGO. #Bachelorette

— B Haynes (@barbhaynes) July 3, 2012

Host: "You just told me about 4 phenomenal home town visits." I thought he was gonna say 4 phenomenal homos. #Bachelorette
